info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued January 19 at 4:39AM EST by NWS Detroit
info.description: ...A WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY IS IN EFFECT... WEATHER... * Light snow with highly localized embedded lake effect snow bands will persist through the morning commute. * The main snow band observed on radar is impacting portions of Sanilac County, particularly between across Forestville and south towards Forester. This band is extending inland across Deckerville and has the potential to impact Sandusky and Carsonville this morning. * Hourly snowfall rates are expected to hold steady around two- tenths of an inch per hour through 7 AM. Snow rates up to an inch per hour will be likely within the lake effect snow band. * Highly fluctuating visibilities down to a half-mile or less will be possible with the lake effect snow band. * Air temperatures will range between 17 and 20 degrees. IMPACTS... * Accumulating snow will lead to slippery roads, particularly on bridges, exit ramps and overpasses. * Lake effect snow bands will bring a reduction in visibility down to a half- mile or less at times. && PRECAUTIONARY/PREPAREDNESS ACTIONS... * Prepare, plan and stay informed. Visit http://go.usa.gov/c7kkP
